page.title: 03UPHAM CHURCH ROOF
page.content: The tower roof was rebuilt in 1700 and again in 1881, but the beams rotted and fell down this year, which is 1985. The wood from the rafters crumbles to dust in your hands. Some workmen are rebuilding the roof. They put down underfelt beneath the random peg tiles. They used to use wooden pegs to hang the tiles on, but now they use nails. They had to screw the new rafters under the roof. There is about Â£1000 worth of lead on the new roof. Some of the old lead is being replaced by zinc, because it is much cheaper. The lead is used for keeping the rain from getting into the church.The villagers had to raise Â£8000 for the rebuilding of the roof. Some of the old lead is being sold to help with the cost.
